alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 5:08PM EST until December 30 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Below Resvr...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM EST Thursday was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 03/23/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.7 Thu 4 pm 5.1 4.3 6.0 7pm 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EST.
